    • Constructor Detail

      • MarkovChain

        public MarkovChain(double[] initialProbabilities,
                   java.util.ArrayList<Matrix> transitionMatrices)
        Creates a Markov chain with the given initial probabilities and transition matrices. Note that the initial probabilities array should contain as many probabilities as there are states. Similarly each transition matrix should be a #states x #states matrix. The transitionMatrices is a list in case the Markov chain is dependent on time. In this case, each transition matrix is valid for one time interval, in the same way "time" is used in the "getStateAt" method.
        Parameters:
        initialProbabilities - initial probabilities for each state
        transitionMatrices - list of transition matrices for each time interval

    • Method Detail

      • getInitialState

        public int getInitialState()
        Returns:
        the initial state using the initial probabilities.

      • getStateAt

        public int getStateAt(int time,
                      int previousState)
        Parameters:
        time - the current time interval
        previousState - the current state before calling this method
        Returns:
        the next state at the given time with the previous state.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the time parameter is less than 0 or greater than the number of transition matrices

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns:
        the size of the Markov chain, i.e. the number of time intervals it can be used for.

      • doStateTransition

        private int doStateTransition(double[] probabilities)
        Returns the next state using the given probabilities.
        Parameters:
        probabilities - the probabilities of each state being chosen next - they must add up to 1.
        Returns:
        the next state.

      • checkStateProbabilities

        private void checkStateProbabilities(double[] probabilities)
        Checks whether the sum of the values within the probability array is less than 0.99. If so, it throws an exception.
        Parameters:
        probabilities -
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the sum of the probabilities is less than 0.99
